newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ SPORT - NZCC draft opposes rugby transfer rules.
newsitem.headline: NZ SPORT - NZCC draft opposes rugby transfer rules.

text.p: The New Zealand Commerce Commission said in a draft ruling on Tuesday that it would not authorise proposed rugby union transfer rules on the information currently available to it.
The Commission said its decision was based on examining the relationship between rugby unions in the trading of rights to players' services.

"The Commission's preliminary view is that the cap on the number of players a union can acquire, the transfer fees it must pay and the restriction of transfers to November only, all substantially lessen competition," it said in a statement.

"The cap on player numbers prevents competing unions acquiring player services and the cap on transfer fees is a form of price fixing. The Commission preliminary conclusions are that both detriments and benefits from the arrangements are small, and it is not satisfied that benefits outweigh detriments."

The New Zealand Rugby Football Union has until November 6 to make submissions on the draft ruling, and a conference is planned for November 18-20 to give the NZRFU and interested parties the chance to make submissions.
The Commission said it would release a final decision by about December 17. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 4734 746
